newsitem.title: INDIA: Hero Honda invests in new India plant.
newsitem.headline: Hero Honda invests in new India plant.

text.p: India's Hero Honda Motors Ltd said on Thursday that it had invested 1.8 billion rupees in a new plant that will begin producing the Street motorcycle this week.

"We have made an investment of 1.8 billion rupees and have set up a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility at Gurgaon for Street," Hero Honda director Pawan Munjal said in a statement released at a ceremony to launch the 100 cc motorcycle.
Gurgaon is on the outskirts of the Indian capital.

Hero Motors, controlled by India's Munjal family, signed a 1984 technical agreement which gave the group access to Honda Motor Co Ltd's technology to make light motorcycles. The joint venture was called Hero Honda.

Munjal said the new plant had annual production capacity of 300,000 motorcycles. Initially the factory would manufacture 100,000 a year, he said, without indicating for how long that production level would be maintained.
"This new facility will commence production on January 24, 1997, to roll out the first Street manufactured in India," Munjal said. -- New Delhi newsroom +91-11 301 2024
